page.title: 04TRANSPORT
page.content: TRANSPORT Most people in this area rely on their own transport as there is little in the way of public services. Almost all every day amenities are beyond walking distance so peoplle without cars rely on friends or neighbours or on the local bus service. For those people in or near the village there are three buses a day, a National Bus Company service. For people in outlying areas there is one bus a week. No buses run on Sundays or after early evening. There is a small rail halt about seven miles away, although the main line station twelve miles away at Shrewsbury would probably be reached as quickly. There are no petrol facilities within the area, and although the village boasts a car repair workshop, it appears to be a rather run down affair.
